001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakHistory;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonHistory;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.OutbreakState;
010import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonState;
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.behaviour.NonCompliant;
012import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
013
014/**
015 * A generic state machine implementation for managing transitions between
016 * different behavioral and policy states in agent-based models.
017 *
018 * Supports both individual behavior patterns (BehaviorState) and policy
019 * patterns (PolicyState). State transitions are implemented using enumerated
020 * states that define transition logic through history updates and state
021 * updates.
022 *
023 * <h2>Transition Cycle</h2>
024 * <p>
025 * The state machine follows a two-phase update cycle:
026 * <ul>
027 * <li><b>History Update Phase</b>: Occurs early in the update cycle, handling
028 * actions like testing that need to be recorded</li>
029 * <li><b>State Update Phase</b>: Occurs at the end of the update cycle,
030 * determining the next state based on current conditions</li>
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * <h2>Usage Patterns</h2>
034 * <ul>
035 * <li>For individual agents: manages behavior state transitions</li>
036 * <li>For outbreaks/policies: manages policy state transitions</li>
037 * <li>Supports forced state transitions and branching state management</li>
038 * </ul>
039 *
040 * @see State.BehaviourState
041 * @see State.PolicyState
042 */
043public class StateMachine implements Serializable {
044
045        /**
046         * Creates a stub state machine without initial state or context.
047         *
048         * @return a new stub StateMachine instance
049         */
050        public static StateMachine stub() {
051                return new StateMachine();
052        }
053
054        private ModifiableStateMachineContext context;
055
056        private State<?, ?, ?, ?> currentState;
057
058        /** Default constructor for creating an uninitialized state machine. */
059        public StateMachine() {}
060
061        /**
062         * Constructs a state machine with a default state and context.
063         *
064         * @param defaultStateMachineState the initial state for the state machine
065         * @param context                  the initial context for the state machine
066         */
067        public StateMachine(
068                        State<?, ?, ?, ?> defaultStateMachineState, StateMachineContext context
069        ) {
070                this.context = ModifiableStateMachineContext.create().from(context);
071                this.currentState = defaultStateMachineState;
072        }
073
074        /**
075         * Forces a transition to a specific behavior state (except DEAD state).
076         * Maintains state branching history when switching between different
077         * behavior models.
078         *
079         * @param state the target behavior state
080         * @throws RuntimeException if attempting to update a policy state machine
081         *                          with a behavior state
082         */
083        public void forceTo(State.BehaviourState state) {
084                if (state.equals(NonCompliant.DEAD)) return;
085                if (this.getState() instanceof State.BehaviourState) {
086                        synchronized (this) {
087                                this.rememberCurrentState(state);
088                                this.currentState = state;
089                        }
090                } else
091                        throw new RuntimeException("Cannot update a policy with a behaviour");
092        }
093
094        /**
095         * Forces a transition to a specific policy state. Maintains state branching
096         * history when switching between different policy models.
097         *
098         * @param state the target policy state
099         * @throws RuntimeException if attempting to update a behavior state machine
100         *                          with a policy state
101         */
102        public void forceTo(State.PolicyState state) {
103                if (this.getState() instanceof State.PolicyState) {
104                        synchronized (this) {
105                                // If switching to a different behaviour model
106                                this.rememberCurrentState(state);
107                                this.currentState = state;
108                        }
109                } else
110                        throw new RuntimeException("Cannot update a behaviour with a policy");
111        }
112
113        /**
114         * Gets the current state of the state machine.
115         *
116         * @return the current state object
117         */
118        public State<?, ?, ?, ?> getState() { return this.currentState; }
119
120        /**
121         * Initializes the state machine with a behavior state.
122         *
123         * @param policy the initial behavior state
124         */
125        public void init(State.BehaviourState policy) {
126                this.currentState = policy;
127                this.context = ModifiableStateMachineContext.create()
128                                .setBaselineState(policy);
129        }
130
131        /**
132         * Initializes the state machine with a policy state.
133         *
134         * @param policy the initial policy state
135         */
136        public void init(State.PolicyState policy) {
137                this.currentState = policy;
138                this.context = ModifiableStateMachineContext.create()
139                                .setBaselineState(policy);
140        }
141
142        /**
143         * Performs history update for outbreak states.
144         *
145         * @param builder  the builder for constructing immutable outbreak history
146         * @param outbreak the current outbreak state
147         * @param rng      the random number generator for stochastic operations
148         */
149        public void performHistoryUpdate(
150                        ImmutableOutbreakHistory.Builder builder, OutbreakState outbreak,
151                        Sampler rng
152        ) {
153                if (this.getState() instanceof State.PolicyState) {
154                        State.PolicyState state = (State.PolicyState) this.getState();
155                        state.updateHistory(builder, outbreak, this.context, rng);
156                }
157        }
158
159        /**
160         * Performs history update for person states.
161         *
162         * @param builder the builder for constructing immutable person history
163         * @param person  the current person state
164         * @param rng     the random number generator for stochastic operations
165         */
166        public void performHistoryUpdate(
167                        ImmutablePersonHistory.Builder builder, PersonState person, Sampler rng
168        ) {
169                if (this.getState() instanceof State.BehaviourState) {
170                        State.BehaviourState state = (State.BehaviourState) this.getState();
171                        state.updateHistory(builder, person, this.context, rng);
172                }
173        }
174
175        /**
176         * Updates the state machine and stores the new outbreak state.
177         *
178         * @param builder  the builder for constructing immutable outbreak state
179         * @param outbreak the current outbreak state
180         * @param rng      the random number generator for stochastic operations
181         */
182        public synchronized void performStateUpdate(
183                        ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder builder, OutbreakState outbreak,
184                        Sampler rng
185        ) {
186                if (this.getState() instanceof State.PolicyState) {
187                        State.PolicyState state = (State.PolicyState) this.getState();
188                        State.PolicyState next = state
189                                        .nextState(builder, outbreak, this.context, rng);
190                        this.currentState = next;
191                }
192        }
193
194        /**
195         * Updates the state machine and stores the new person state. Handles death
196         * state transitions automatically.
197         *
198         * @param builder the builder for constructing immutable person state
199         * @param person  the current person state
200         * @param rng     the random number generator for stochastic operations
201         */
202        public synchronized void performStateUpdate(
203                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, PersonState person, Sampler rng
204        ) {
205                if (person.isDead()) {
206                        this.currentState = NonCompliant.DEAD
207                                        .nextState(builder, person, this.context, rng);
208                } else {
209                        if (this.getState() instanceof State.BehaviourState) {
210                                State.BehaviourState state = (State.BehaviourState) this.getState();
211                                State.BehaviourState next = state
212                                                .nextState(builder, person, this.context, rng);
213                                this.currentState = next;
214                        }
215                }
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * Prepares the state machine for an update cycle by resetting context flags.
220         */
221        public void prepareUpdate() {
222                this.context.resetFlags();
223        }
224
225        /**
226         * Remembers the current state if switching between different behavior/policy
227         * models. Only remembers state branches when switching to a different model
228         * (different enum type).
229         *
230         * @param state the target state to compare against current state
231         */
232        public void rememberCurrentState(State<?, ?, ?, ?> state) {
233                if (state instanceof Enum && this.getState() instanceof Enum) {
234                        // Don't remember if this is a different state from same behaviour
235                        // model
236                        if (((Enum<?>) state).getDeclaringClass()
237                                        .equals(((Enum<?>) this.getState()).getDeclaringClass()))
238                                return;
239                }
240                this.context.pushState(this.currentState);
241        }
242
243        /**
244         * Returns to a previously remembered state from a branch. Appropriately
245         * handles both behavior and policy state transitions.
246         */
247        public void returnFromBranch() {
248                if (this.getState() instanceof State.BehaviourState) {
249                        this.currentState = this.context.pullBehaviour();
250                }
251                if (this.getState() instanceof State.PolicyState) {
252                        this.currentState = this.context.pullPolicy();
253                }
254        }
255
256        /**
257         * Returns a string representation of the state machine's current state.
258         *
259         * @return the name of the current state
260         */
261        @Override
262        public String toString() {
263                return this.getState().getName();
264        }
265
266}
